body_html:
Hi, it was implemented in R based on Best, D. J. and D. E. Roberts (1975); Percentage Points of the Chi-Squared Distribution; Applied Statistics 24, page 385, where they added some Newton-Raphson algorithm for stability on top of it.
https://github.com/griffithlab/regtools/blob/master/src/utils/rmath/qgamma.c
Is it OK to use that implementation as the basis for the Tensorflow one?
body_text:
Hi, it was implemented in R based on Best, D. J. and D. E. Roberts (1975); Percentage Points of the Chi-Squared Distribution; Applied Statistics 24, page 385, where they added some Newton-Raphson algorithm for stability on top of it.
https://github.com/griffithlab/regtools/blob/master/src/utils/rmath/qgamma.c
Is it OK to use that implementation as the basis for the Tensorflow one?
body:
Hi, it was implemented in R based on Best, D. J. and D. E. Roberts (1975); Percentage Points of the Chi-Squared Distribution; Applied Statistics 24, page 385, where they added some Newton-Raphson algorithm for stability on top of it.
[https://github.com/griffithlab/regtools/blob/master/src/utils/rmath/qgamma.c](https://github.com/griffithlab/regtools/blob/master/src/utils/rmath/qgamma.c)
Is it OK to use that implementation as the basis for the Tensorflow one?
